mythology.overview: Ragnarok is the prophesied end of the cosmos in Norse mythology - a series of catastrophic events culminating in a great battle that will result in the deaths of numerous gods and the destruction of the Nine Realms.
mythology.uniqueAspect: What makes Ragnarok unique is that the gods know it is coming. Despite this knowledge, Ragnarok cannot be prevented - it is woven into the fabric of fate itself.

description: Ragnarok (Old Norse: Ragnarök or Ragnarøkkr) is the prophesied end of the cosmos in Norse mythology—a series of catastrophic events culminating in a great battle that will result in the deaths of numerous gods, the destruction of the Nine Realms, and the submersion of the world in water. Yet from this destruction, a new world will arise, purified and renewed.
name: Norse Cosmology

greatDuels.outcome: Fenrir will swallow Odin. Vidar will avenge his father.
Thor kills the serpent but dies from its venom after nine steps.
Freyr will fall because he gave away his magical sword.

aftermath: After Ragnarok, the world will rise again from the sea, green and fertile. Surviving gods include Vidar, Vali, Modi, Magni, and Baldr returns from Hel. Two humans, Lif and Lifthrasir, survive by hiding in Yggdrasil.
